text: hey joseline with Walter's world lemon
beautiful Costa Rica and today I wanted
to do a video for you about coming to
Costa Rica with your kids and I highly
recommend it you really should bring
your kids here it's an amazing adventure
and part of why it's an amazing
adventure is because there are so many
things to do this isn't one of those
trips where you're going to museum after
museum this is activity field there are
all the beach things you know my kids
have taken surfing lessons and there's
fishing tons of sport fishing here
there's boat rides sea kayaking lake and
river kayaking all all these watersports
are just there they're plentiful let me
tell you and then there is the things
like the tours and hikes through
beautiful national forests like manuel
antonio there are hanging bridge tours
which we really enjoyed we took a
cooking class with a local family near
the Arenal Volcano and then we ate with
them which was a great experience for
both us and for our kids the family time
in Costa Rica has been just exquisite I
mean the things we've done in the
memories we've made on this trip are
gonna definitely last a lifetime
and as you take these tours you may go
on a night tour and try to see the
poisonous tree frogs and different kinds
of snakes and things there macaws and
sloths and Cody's which are related to
raccoons and very cool there's just
there's plentiful wildlife and if you're
very quiet on your tours you might just
get to see some we saw spider monkeys
they're howler monkeys white faced
squirrel monkeys there's just a ton to
see and that kind of leads into the idea
of ecotourism Costa Rica is very eco
friendly in 2015 all of their
electricity was naturally generated by
hydropower wind power
and geothermal and solar power so this
country's really got it together on
ecotourism and your kids are gonna learn
so much when we went on our tour through
the rainforests and hanging bridges we
our guide was amazing and we learned so
much about not only just this rainforest
but rainforests in general and about
specific plants and wildlife and it was
a great lesson in science for both us
and our kids so I highly recommend
taking a couple of those tours if you're
in Costa Rica some things you should
know about bringing your kids to Costa
Rica first and foremost the Sun is hot
and it's intense here you're near the
equator so you need to get sunblock our
luggage got lost and I had to buy
sunblock and for a regular sized can of
SPF 50 it was 17 US dollars um that's
like three times what you pay in the US
so I would suggest bringing that with
you maybe and also the same goes for bug
repellent tons of bugs in the rain
forest like tons of bugs in the rain
forest so it's not a bad idea to put
something on to kind of keep some of the
critters away on that I also bring
benadryl our youngest has really bad
reactions to bug bites so I always take
a little bit of children's benadryl and
some after right you know the little
pins you can just kind of put it on and
take the itch out so nobody's
complaining throughout the rest of a
tour going on it gee yes it's it's a
good smart thing to do with your kid so
a couple other things that you might
want to bring with you to Costa Rica
especially if you're in the interior
you're gonna want a poncho as the locals
will tell you they have a rainy season
and in not so rainy season they never
call it the dry season because in the
interior especially in the rain forest
um it rains everyday it's a rain forest
so poncho might not be a bad idea
although really it rains for like 10
minutes and then it's done raining for a
couple of hours so you have a little
time to dry out the other thing that you
definitely need wherever you are is a
good sturdy pair of shoes because all
the tours are going to be
up and down this is a mountainous
country there's a lot of dirt and rocks
you need good grippy shoes especially if
you're doing like a hanging bridge tour
we went on the longest hanging bridge
there was and there was a torrential
downpour and I was really grateful that
we all had good sturdy grippy bottom
shoes so we weren't slipping and sliding
on on the hanging bridges because it was
frightening enough so you might want to
think about bringing those couple extra
things with you to some safety things
you need to know first and foremost in
any country you visit you need to know
the emergency number for Costa Rica it's
911 which makes it really easy for
Americans to remember since it's the
same thing
car safety we found that in every
vehicle that we've been in there are
only lap belts in the back so some some
car seats don't work with that so you
should just be aware of that that that's
seems to be pretty much the only thing
that you have to strap kids in with and
that's sort of just what we've done we
do have booster seats that are travel
seats but they don't really help if it's
just a lap belt so we've just left them
out and strapped the kids in with a lap
belt so be aware of that and if you have
picky eaters most of the restaurants
especially on the resort's they all have
children's menus and they're either fish
nuggets chicken nuggets spaghetti you
know really simple foods that pretty
much all kids will eat some of the local
restaurants which you should really take
your kids to because they're fantastic
they're called sodas even they had like
smaller portions and things most of it's
rice and beans or you know a meat or
fish mixed in with those things but you
know rice and beans are things that my
kids eat I don't know about everybody
else's but our kids really enjoyed the
local food but if they are picky eaters
know that most places have a children's
menu that's nice and easy
most of the portions are so big that
it's really easy to split a meal with
your kid Caleb and I did it quite a few
times in Mark and Liam split
and the menus a couple of times too so
that was that makes it really easy along
with eating you're gonna wonder about
the water water in Costa Rica is safe to
drink that we haven't had any problems
with any of the water so just know that
your water is drinkable so those are my
tips for bringing your kids to Costa
Rica I really hope you do it because the
memories and the experiences here are
just fantastic check us out on Walters
world YouTube Facebook Instagram all the
social media will be there waiting for
you give us a thumbs up if you liked
this video thanks bye from Costa Rica
